content.question: A duck flies past a truck that is at rest. The duck takes <math alttext="2.1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.1</mn></math> seconds to fly at constant speed <math alttext="v sub d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>d</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> from the back of the truck to the front. Later, the truck travels along a flat, straight roadway with a constant speed <math alttext="three fourths v sub d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>d</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>. The duck again flies past the truck with constant speed <math alttext="v sub d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>d</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, flying in the same direction that the truck is moving. How long does it take the duck to fly from the back of the truck to the front in this case?
